main event: A civilian reported an unidentified aerial object in Mount Prospect, Illinois on March 5, 1967.
interesting points: The object was described as orange and larger than visible stars., The sighting involved two pieces that were separated at different time intervals., The observer's reliability is unknown., The object's course was noted to move straight from east to west at 20 degrees elevation., The weather conditions during the sighting were clear with no obstructions reported.
sighted object: an orange ball larger than visible stars
